problem: What value of $x$ makes the equation below true: $$2x + 4 = |{-17 + 3}|$$
solution: Note that $|{-17 + 3}| = |{-14}| = 14$.  Thus we must solve $2x + 4 = 14$, which is the same as $2x = 10$, or $x = \boxed{5}$.
chatgpt_solution:
We simplify the right side of the equation to get  \begin{align*}
|{-17 + 3}| &= |{-14}| \\
&= 14.
\end{align*}So we have $2x + 4 = 14$. Subtracting 4 from both sides gives $2x=10$, and dividing both sides by 2 gives $x=\boxed{5}$.
